result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Allen Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bradley Allen Olson in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
ADA Marcoux states content of plea agreement
Court addresses DEF. Goes through plea questionaire.
Court addresses DEF's attorney.
Court finds DEF understands proceedings and is waiving rights voluntarily.
DEF pleads NC/G.
Court accepts plea.
ADA Marcoux: DEF has no prior criminal history, has no objection to expungement if DEF is successful onprobation
Atty Moldenhauer: agrees appropriate
Court addresses DEF. 
Court finds DEF guily. Imposes fine of $100.00 plus  costs totalling $ 379.. plus DNA surcharge. Also restitution of $ 47.37 plus surcharges, joint and several with Tristan Blaze Duffy, payable to Nick and Amber Al-Moghrabi.
The Defendant can Petition the the court for Expunction after  having completed the terms of the sentence.
Combined with 15CM342 and 15CM402.  No special conditions.
combined with 15 CM 342 and 15 CM 402.  No special conditions

Defendant Bradley Allen Olson in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Bradley Allen Olson in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states address is correct on the complaint.  Court addressed the defendant and recites charges.  Atty Moldenhauer stands mute on all counts.  Court quashed warrants on all matters.   State addressed the court offer was extended and was accepted, makes further stmt.  requests signature bond be re-instated up to $2000.00 same conditions. forfeiture proceedings suspended.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Moldenhauer does not know where client is.
ADA Marcoux requests warrant-body only. 
Court: Warrant authorized. Start forfeiture proceedings.
9/23/15 Copy of cover letter to ADA Marcoux
Combined Bond (15CM338 and 15CM342)  No Special Conditions.

Combined Bond (15CM338 and 15CM342)

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Counsel enters NG Plea.
